document.docAuthor: Mengmeng Liu, Zejian Li, Jian Shang & Meicai Wei
document.docTitle: Macrophya qinlingium Li, Liu & Wei, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of annulitibia - group of the genus Macrophya Dahlbom (Hymenoptera: Tenthredinidae) in Mts. Qinling from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of annulitibia - group of the genus Macrophya Dahlbom (Hymenoptera: Tenthredinidae) in Mts. Qinling from China

heading.emphasis:
Macrophya qinlingium Li, Liu & Wei
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variety. Length of yellowish white ring in middle of hind tibia and black maculae on base of hind tarsomere 1 more or less in female; yellowish white ring in middle of hind tibia narrowed more or less.

Distribution. China (Liaoning, Ningxia, Gansu, Shaanxi, Henan, Hubei, Sichuan, Yunnan).

Etymology. This new specific name “
qinlingium
” is based on the locality of specimen collected mainly in Mts. Qinling from China .

caption.paragraph:
Figures 9–21.
Macrophya
qinlingium Li
, Liu
& Wei
,
sp. nov.
9. Female, dorsal view. 10. Male, dorsal view. 11. Female head, dorsal view. 12. Female head, anterior view. 13. Female antenna. 14. Female mesopleuron and metapleuron. 15. Ovipositor sheath, lateral view. 16. Lancet. 17. 7th–9th serrulae of lancet. 18. Male head, anterior view. 19. Male antenna. 20. Gonoforceps. 21. Penis valve. Scale bars: 9–10 = 2 mm; 16, 20–21 =200 μm; 17 = 50 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The new species is similar to
M. annulitibia
Takeuchi, 1933
, but differs from the latter in having postocellar area about 2 times broader than long; hind tarsomere 1 largely pale yellowish white at apex, shortly black at base. In
M. annulitibia
, the postocellar area is 2.5 times broader than long; the hind tarsomere 1 is entirely black. It is easy to be distinguished from other known species.
